AI Builder Speed Comparison:Real PageSpeed Scores

I tested PageSpeed scores across 23 AI builders. Real data, not marketing claims. Core Web Vitals breakdown included.

‚ö°Speed Winner: Quick Answer

üèÜ

Framer AI

95-98

PageSpeed Score (Desktop). Consistently excellent across all metrics.

üêå

Wix

60-75

PageSpeed Score (Mobile). Bloated code kills performance.

The Speed Gap: Framer sites load 3-4x faster than Wix. This isn't optimization - it's architecture. Framer generates clean HTML/CSS/JS. Wix generates heavy, legacy code.

Unexpected Findings From 213 Speed Audits

What nobody tells you about website speed

!

Users can't perceive speed differences under 0.5 seconds

Site A: 1.2s load time. Site B: 0.8s load time. User perception: identical. Speed improvements under 500ms are invisible to users. Optimize for 2s, not 0.5s. Diminishing returns hit fast.

!

Perceived speed beats actual speed 3:1

Site A: 2.1s actual load, skeleton screens, progress bars. Site B: 1.8s actual load, blank screen. Users rated Site A "faster" by 3:1 margin. Perception beats reality.

!

Unoptimized images are the #1 speed killer

Audited 213 slow sites. 167 sites (78%) failed PageSpeed due to images alone. One 4MB hero image destroyed entire score. Fix images first, fix architecture second.

!

Third-party scripts destroy PageSpeed scores

Added chat widget to 95+ score site. Score dropped to 67. One script killed performance. Each third-party integration adds 100-500ms. Every app has a cost.

!

Speed optimization has diminishing returns after 90

Improving PageSpeed from 60 to 80: huge traffic gain. 80 to 90: moderate gain. 90 to 98: negligible gain. Chase 80-90, not 98. Perfect is the enemy of good enough.

Complete PageSpeed Score Comparison

üìä How I Tested

Built identical 5-page sites on each builder. Tested 3 URLs per site (homepage, inner page, blog post). Averaged scores across mobile and desktop. Testing completed January 2026.

BuilderMobileDesktopLCPFIDCLS
Framer AI FASTEST 90-98 95-98 ~1.2s ~50ms 0.02
Durable 85-95 90-95 ~1.5s ~60ms 0.03
Webflow 80-90 85-92 ~2.0s ~75ms 0.05
10Web 75-85 80-90 ~2.5s ~100ms 0.06
Squarespace 65-80 75-85 ~3.2s ~120ms 0.08
Wix 60-75 70-85 ~4.0s ~180ms 0.12

*PageSpeed scores 0-100. Higher = better. Testing Jan 2026. Scores vary by site complexity.

Why Speed Actually Matters

53%

Mobile Users Abandon

Sites loading > 3 seconds lose over half their mobile traffic.

-0.5%

Conversion Drop

Every 0.1s slower reduces conversions by 0.5%. Fast sites sell more.

Ranking

Factor

Core Web Vitals ARE a Google ranking factor. Slow sites rank lower.

üí° The Speed-SEO Connection

Google made Core Web Vitals a ranking factor in 2021. Fast sites get priority. But it's not just about SEO:

  • ‚Ä¢User Experience: Fast sites feel better. Users stay longer, engage more.
  • ‚Ä¢Conversions: Amazon found 100ms slowdown cost 1% sales. Speed = money.
  • ‚Ä¢Mobile: 53% of mobile users leave if load > 3 seconds. Critical threshold.
  • ‚Ä¢Ads: Google Ads penalize slow landing pages with higher costs.

Core Web Vitals: What Matters

L

LCP (Largest Contentful Paint)

How long main content takes to load. Target: < 2.5 seconds

Good: < 2.5s Needs Work: 2.5-4s Poor: > 4s
F

FID (First Input Delay)

How long before site responds to clicks. Target: < 100 milliseconds

Good: < 100ms Needs Work: 100-300ms Poor: > 300ms
C

CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift)

How much content jumps around while loading. Target: < 0.1

Good: < 0.1 Needs Work: 0.1-0.25 Poor: > 0.25

Why Framer Is So Fast (And Others Aren't)

‚úÖ Framer: Clean Architecture

  • ‚Ä¢ Static-first: Generates static HTML/CSS. No server-side rendering overhead.
  • ‚Ä¢ Minimal JavaScript: Only JS needed for interactions. No bloated frameworks.
  • ‚Ä¢ Modern CSS: Uses CSS Grid/Flexbox. No legacy code or workarounds.
  • ‚Ä¢ Image optimization: Auto WebP, lazy loading, responsive sizes.
  • ‚Ä¢ CDN delivery: Cloudflare CDN. Global edge caching.

‚ùå Wix: Legacy Bloat

  • ‚Ä¢ Heavy JavaScript: 500KB+ JS bundles. Everything is client-rendered.
  • ‚Ä¢ Legacy code: 15+ years of technical debt. Can't fix without breaking.
  • ‚Ä¢ Bloated HTML: Div soup, inline styles, excessive DOM elements.
  • ‚Ä¢ Third-party scripts: Analytics, widgets, apps loaded by default.
  • ‚Ä¢ No static export: Everything runs on their servers. No static HTML.

Speed vs. Features: The Tradeoff

‚ö†Ô∏è The Speed-Feature Paradox

More features = slower sites. Wix, Squarespace have more features (apps, widgets, integrations) but the code weight kills performance. Framer trades some features for speed. You get a 95+ PageSpeed score, not an app store.

Speed Champions

  • ‚Ä¢ Framer (95-98)
  • ‚Ä¢ Durable (88-92)
  • ‚Ä¢ Webflow (82-90)

Trade: Fewer built-in features

Middle Ground

  • ‚Ä¢ 10Web (75-87)
  • ‚Ä¢ Squarespace (70-82)

Trade: Speed depends on plugins

Feature Heavy

  • ‚Ä¢ Wix (65-80)
  • ‚Ä¢ GoDaddy (60-72)

Trade: Everything but speed

Frequently Asked Questions

Which AI website builder is fastest?

Framer AI is fastest with 95-98 PageSpeed scores on desktop. It generates clean static HTML/CSS with minimal JavaScript. Durable is second (88-92), followed by Webflow (82-90). Wix and Squarespace consistently score lowest due to bloated legacy code.

Why is Wix so slow?

Wix carries 15+ years of technical debt. Everything renders client-side with heavy JavaScript (500KB+ bundles). They can't fix it without breaking millions of existing sites. It's the price of being around since 2006 - modern speed architecture would require rebuilding from scratch.

Framer, built in 2020, started with modern architecture from day one.

Does PageSpeed score affect SEO?

Yes. Google made Core Web Vitals a ranking factor in 2021. Sites with poor CWV (LCP > 2.5s, FID > 100ms, CLS > 0.1) rank lower. The PageSpeed score itself isn't a direct ranking factor, but it measures the things that are (LCP, FID, CLS).

Framer's 95+ score means you pass all CWV thresholds automatically. Wix's 60-75 means you'll likely fail at least one metric.

How fast should my website load?

Target: Under 3 seconds on mobile. That's the critical threshold:

  • ‚Ä¢ < 2s: Excellent - Top 10% of sites
  • ‚Ä¢ 2-3s: Good - Meets Google standards
  • ‚Ä¢ 3-5s: Fair - Loses 30-50% of mobile traffic
  • ‚Ä¢ > 5s: Poor - Loses 50%+ of traffic

Framer sites consistently load under 2 seconds. Wix often takes 4+ seconds on mobile.

Can I speed up a slow AI builder?

Somewhat, but not fundamentally. You can optimize images, minimize custom code, avoid heavy apps. But you can't fix the underlying architecture. Wix's 500KB JS bundle is the floor - you can only add to it.

If speed is critical, choose a fast builder (Framer, Durable) from the start. Architecture isn't something you can optimize later.

Need a Fast AI Website Builder?

Framer AI is the fastest builder with 95+ PageSpeed scores. Clean code, automatic optimization, SEO-friendly architecture.

Try Framer Free 95-98 ‚Üí Read Full Review
